name: NPR
text: The Supreme Court on Monday overturned a lower court decision that blocked construction of a 600-mile gas pipeline crossing underneath the Appalachian Trail.  https://t.co/hwICIR6pR5

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: It was a moment years in the making, but one well worth the wait. Watch @aliciakeys debut a new song at the Tiny Desk. https://t.co/dUc9bchSaJ

name: NPR
text:
Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Monday signed bills requiring officers to report within 6 hours of when they fire their weapons, requiring courts to gather demographic data and requiring police to give medical and mental health attention to people in custody.
https://t.co/rJ6coCSzat

name: NPR
text:
African Americans have been fighting and dying for the U.S. from the outset, filmmaker Spike Lee says — just look at Crispus Attucks, the first American killed in the Revolutionary War. 
https://t.co/qC33PJXFZw

name: NPR
text: RT @NinaTotenberg: Justice Neil Gorsuch broke with his fellow #SCOTUS conservatives today to deliver a win for LGBT rights. Chief Justice Roberts tagged along, while Justice Alito compared the majority to “pirates” sailing under a “textualist flag.” https://t.co/FsYA6fJfqp

name: NPR
text:
RT @planetmoney: .@DrLisaDCook found a hole in one of the central theories of economic growth – the impact of racial violence on innovation. But getting her colleagues to see it took ten years. 

https://t.co/9nth99bZ54

name: NPR
text:
President Trump is expected to sign an executive order for police reform on Tuesday.

White House officials say it will focus on credentialing officers and creating a database to track officer misconduct, among other things.
https://t.co/iqoFBVlAiD

name: NPR
text:
Several airlines will take action against passengers who do not comply with face-covering rules, which could include putting people on a no-fly list, according to a new industry pact.
https://t.co/HIIvH4spKo

name: NPR
text:
Singer-songwriter Lido Pimienta defines her much-anticipated album “Miss Colombia” as a "series of cynical love letters" to her country of birth — tackling issues of misogyny and anti-blackness in Latin America and beyond.
https://t.co/EnczlB4gX4

name: NPR
text:
The Justice Department has announced it will once again begin federal executions next month after a 17-year hiatus.
https://t.co/F8sjt4GQVK

name: NPR
text:
The term “urban contemporary” was coined to make radio stations that played black music more appealing to advertisers.

But its use means that no matter the variety of music black artists make — it's all swept into the same limiting category.
https://t.co/1Dy8Xd0VE8

name: NPR
text:
The National Book Critics Circle — which represents hundreds of critics across the country — has been roiled by a dispute over an anti-racism statement that has led several board members to resign.
https://t.co/qcfJvgfqoS

name: NPR
text:
Oklahoma State running back Chuba Hubbard says he won't participate with the program after a photo surfaced showing his head coach wearing a shirt emblazoned with the logo of a far-right TV network that has a history of supporting Trump.
https://t.co/P9CU817tGp
